EmailTemplate.subject: Planned updates to the Global Partner Program
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
${preheader} View as web page <[[{{system.viewAsWebpageLink}}]]> Planned updates to the Global Partner Program and the Associated Documents as part of your Nokia Partner Program Agreement May 1, 2018
Dear Partner,
I would like to inform you that Nokia has planned Partner Program updates to the Associated Documents which are an integral part of your Partner Program Agreement (PPA).
The following Associated Documents with planned updates include:
- Partner Program Rules - Partner Pricing Rules - Partner Maintenance Conditions - Partner Deal Registration and Deal Origination Discount Program Rules - Co-op Program Rules - Glossary of Partner Program Terms
Please note that your existing Partner Program Agreement does not change, only the Associated Documents listed above that govern the Global Partner Program.
These Associated Documents will be made available for early preview on the Nokia Partner Portal > Topic Catalogue > Partner Programs > Support Assets on 1 May 2018 and will become effective on 1 June 2018.
On this effective date, these updated Associated Documents will supersede all previous versions.
For your information, please find attached hereto a summary of the most important planned changes to these Associated Documents.
If you have any queries, please do not hesitate to contact your Nokia Partner Sales Manager.
Todd Roth Senior Director, Nokia Global Partner Program
Summary of planned changes to Associated Documents
Partner Program Rules:
- Art 4.2 Partner Business Plan: updated; - Art 5.c Maintenance Services: validity date extended; - Art 6.2 Partner Staff Certification: terms updated; - Art 7 Partner Program Services: terms updated; validity date Maintenance Services extended.
Partner Pricing Rules:
- Art 3.3 Back-End Rebate: removed; - Art 4 Partner Maintenance Purchase Price: validity date extended; - Art 5 Partner Lab Equipment Purchase Price: updated reference to the Partner Lab Equipment Offer.
Partner Maintenance Conditions:
- The current Maintenance Conditions are applicable only to Partners who have signed Partner Program Agreement – RES version 02_03 or earlier and will remain valid until termination of the Agreement.
Partner Deal Registration (DR) and Deal Origination Discount (DOD) Rules:
- Art 2 Nokia Deal Registration Process: process description deleted. Reference to available trainings in Nokia’s PRM added.
Partner Co-op Program Rules:
- Art 1 Program Overview: updated, reimbursement by ACH or wire transfer deleted; - Art 2 Program Eligibility: updated; - Art 3 Co-Op Program Online Tool: updated; - Art 5 Lifecycle of an accrual period: dates updated; - Art 6 Eligible activities: updated; - Art 8 How to use Co-Op accruals and receive reimbursements: all steps updated; - Art 9 Activity Types and associated PoP Requirements: updated.
Glossary of Partner Program Terms:
- New definitions used in the Partner Program, the Partner Maintenance Agreements and the Associated Documents added.
